attrs.description: This attribute gives you the option to control animation in your charts. If you do not want to animate any part of the chart, set this as 0.
attrs.name: animation

attrs.description:
This attribute sets the animation duration of the chart. `animationDuration` attribute is applicable only if animation of the chart is enabled. 

Default value: 1 sec
attrs.name: animationDuration

attrs.description:
Animates the plot in clockwise direction. 

Default value: 0
attrs.name: animateClockwise

attrs.description:
Instead of rotational animation, you can set alpha animation which displays your chart slowly from `0` alpha to `100`. 

Default value : 0
attrs.name: alphaAnimation

attrs.description: FusionCharts XT uses the concept of Color Palettes. Each chart has 5 pre-defined color palettes which you can choose from. Each palette renders the chart in a different color theme.
attrs.name: palette

attrs.description: While the `palette` attribute allows to select a palette theme that applies to chart background, canvas, font and tool-tips, it does not change the colors of data items (i.e., column, line, pie etc.). Using `paletteColors` attribute, you can specify your custom list of hex colors for the data items. The list of colors have to be separated by comma e.g., `"paletteColors": "#FF0000, #0372AB, #FF5904..."`. The chart will cycle through the list of specified colors and then render the data plot accordingly. To use the same set of colors throughout all your charts in a web application, you can store the list of palette colors in your application globally and then provide the same in each chart JSON.
attrs.range: List of hex color codes separated by comma
attrs.name: paletteColors

attrs.description: Configuration whether to show pies with 0 values (and their values). Otherwise, they won't show up in the chart.
attrs.name: showZeroPies

attrs.description: Whether to show percentage values in labels of the chart.
attrs.name: showPercentValues

attrs.description: Whether to show percentage values in tool tip.
attrs.name: showPercentInToolTip

attrs.description: Whether to show labels on the chart.
attrs.name: showLabels

attrs.description: Whether to show values on the chart.
attrs.name: showValues

attrs.description: The character to separate the data label and data values on the chart.
attrs.name: labelSepChar

attrs.description: The entire chart can now act as a hotspot. Use this URL to define the hotspot link for the chart. The link can be specified in FusionCharts Link format.
attrs.name: clickURL

attrs.description:
Sets whether the `clickURL` attribute (that sets a link to which the user is directed when the chart is clicked) overrides the `link` attribute (that sets a link to which the user is directed when a data plot is clicked). 

Default value: 0 (`clickURL` does not override `link`)
attrs.name: clickURLOverridesPlotLinks

attrs.description: Uses the same data plot color for data labels.
attrs.name: useDataPlotColorForLabels

attrs.description: This attribute, when set to __1__, indicates to the chart that the text (rendered on the chart) may contain RTL characters and the textual display has to be managed accordingly.
attrs.name: hasRTLText

attrs.description:
This attribute lets you enable/disable the highlight effect, in the form of a `fadeout`, for the data plots corresponding to a legend item. When this attribute is enabled and the mouse pointer is hovered over a legend item label, plots belonging to the other data series fadeout, by reducing their opacity.

 The fadeout effect can be customized by specifying the fadeout color and opacity using the `color` and `alpha` attributes. Eg. `fadeout|color=#ff0000, alpha=60`
attrs.name: plotHighlightEffect

attrs.description: This attribute changes the theme of the chart. There are 7 types of themes which have been made according to the different color combinations.
attrs.name: theme

description: These attributes let you control a variety of functional elements on the chart. For example, you can opt to show/hide data labels, data values etc. You can also set chart limits and extended properties.

attrs.description: Caption of the chart.
attrs.name: caption

attrs.description: Sub-caption of the chart.
attrs.name: subCaption

description: Using these attributes, you can set the various headings and titles of chart like caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description: Sets horizontal alignment of caption
attrs.name: captionAlignment

attrs.description: Whether caption should be on top of the data plot area
attrs.name: captionOnTop

attrs.description: Sets the caption font size in pixels. Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: captionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font size (in pixels). Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: subCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the caption font family
attrs.name: captionFont

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font family
attrs.name: subCaptionFont

attrs.description: Sets the caption font color
attrs.name: captionFontColor

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font color
attrs.name: subCaptionFontColor

attrs.description: Whether the caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: captionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the sub caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: subCaptionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the caption is aligned with the canvas. Else, it will be aligned with the entire chart area
attrs.name: alignCaptionWithCanvas

attrs.description:
If caption is not centre aligned, lets you configure the padding (in pixels) from either edge.
Will be ignored if caption is centre aligned.
attrs.name: captionHorizontalPadding

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of chart caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description: Whether to show a border around the chart or not.
attrs.name: showBorder

attrs.description: Border color of the chart.
attrs.name: borderColor

attrs.description: Border thickness of the chart.
attrs.name: borderThickness

attrs.description: Border alpha of the chart.
attrs.name: borderAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute. To specify a gradient as background color, separate the hex color codes of each color in the gradient using comma. Example: `#FF5904, #FFFFFF`.
attrs.name: bgColor

attrs.description: Sets the alpha (transparency) for the background. If you've opted for gradient background, you need to set a list of alpha(s) separated by comma.
attrs.name: bgAlpha

attrs.description: If you've opted for a gradient background, this attribute lets you set the ratio of each color constituent.
attrs.name: bgRatio

attrs.description: Sets the angle of the background color, in case of a gradient.
attrs.name: bgAngle

attrs.description: To place any image (JPG/PNG/GIF) as background of the chart, enter the (path and) name of the background image. It should be in the same domain as the chart.
attrs.name: bgImage

attrs.description: This attribute specifies the opacity for the loaded background image.
attrs.name: bgImageAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you specify the mode in which the background image is to be displayed. Stretch - expands the image to fit the entire chart area, without maintaining original image constraints. Tile - the image is repeated as a pattern on the entire chart area. Fit - fits the image proportionately on the chart area. Fill -proportionately fills the entire chart area with the image. Center - the image is positioned at the center of the chart area. None - Default mode.
attrs.range: stretch, tile, fit, fill, center, none
attrs.name: bgImageDisplayMode

attrs.description: Helps you to vertically align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageVAlign

attrs.description: Helps you to horizontally align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageHAlign

attrs.description: Helps you magnify the background image. This attribute will only work when the attribute `bgImageDisplayMode` is set to none, center, or tile.
attrs.name: bgImageScale

attrs.description: Helps you magnify the background image. This attribute will only work when the attribute `bgImageDisplayMode` is set to none, center, or tile.
attrs.name: showLabelIcon

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to toggle the visibility of the context label displayed in the center of the radial chart. Use it to show or hide additional context or summary information within the chart’s inner area.
attrs.name: showContextLabel

attrs.description: This attribute sets the default context label shown at the center of the radial chart when no bar is hovered. You can include supported inline HTML elements to customize the appearance of the label.
attrs.name: defaultContextLabel

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to define the content of the context label that appears at the center of the radial chart when a bar is hovered over any of the track bars. The attribute supports macros like `$label`, `$value`, `$dataValue`, etc. to dynamically display data-specific information.
attrs.name: contextLabelText

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to define the font of the context label that appears at the center of the radial chart when a bar is hovered over any of the track bars. If this is not defined, then `baseFont` will be used for context labels.
attrs.name: contextLabelFont

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to define the font size of the context label that appears at the center of the radial chart when a bar is hovered over any of the track bars, accepting `px`, `em`, `rem`, `%`, `vw` units. If this is not defined, then `baseFontSize` will be used for context labels.
attrs.name: contextLabelFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to define the font color of the context label that appears at the center of the radial chart when a bar is hovered over any of the track bars. If this is not defined, then `baseFontColor` will be used for context labels.
attrs.name: contextLabelFontColor

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to define the transparency of the context label that appears at the center of the radial chart when a bar is hovered over any of the track bars.
attrs.name: contextLabelAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute controls the visibility of both ticks and their corresponding values on the radial chart. Set it to 1 to display them, or 0 to hide both the ticks and their labels.
attrs.name: showTicks

attrs.description: This attribute lets you manually set the number of tick divisions on the radial chart. If not specified, the chart automatically calculates the divisions based on available space. Invalid or unsupported values will revert the chart to auto mode.
attrs.name: numTicks

attrs.description: This attribute toggles the visibility of the values displayed alongside each tick. By default, the values are visible (1).
attrs.name: showTickValues

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the font of the tick label values for the radial chart.
attrs.name: tickValueLabelFont

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the font size of the tick label values in `px`, `em`, `rem`, `%`, `vw` units for the radial chart.
attrs.name: tickValueFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the font color of the tick label values in hex string for the radial chart.
attrs.name: tickValueFontColor

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the transparency of the tick labels.
attrs.name: tickValueAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute controls the visibility of the tick marks on the radial chart. By default, tick marks are visible.
attrs.name: showTickMarks

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the color of the tick marks.
attrs.name: tickMarkColor

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the tick marks' length in pixels.
attrs.name: tickMarkLength

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the tick marks' thickness in pixels.
attrs.name: tickMarkThickness

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the tick marks transparency in percentage number.
attrs.name: tickAlpha

attrs.description: If `tickAlpha` attribute is defined, the value of `tickValueAlpha` increases / decreases the opacity for value text.
attrs.name: tickValueAlpha

description: The following attributes let you configure chart cosmetics like background color, background alpha, ticks, etc.

attrs.description: Whether the column, area, pie, etc., border will show up. This attribute is used to show or hide the plot border, and it is configurable at the chart instance, data plot, and data-series levels.
attrs.name: showPlotBorder

attrs.description: Color for column, area, pie border. This attribute is used to specify the color for the plot border at the chart instance level.
attrs.name: plotBorderColor

attrs.description: Thickness for column, area, pie border. This attribute is used to specify the thickness for the plot border at chart instance, data plot, and data-series levels.
attrs.name: plotBorderThickness

attrs.description: Alpha for column, area, pie border. This attribute is used to specify the opacity for the plot border at the chart instance level, data plot, and data-series levels.
attrs.name: plotBorderAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the fill alpha for plot. If you've opted to fill the plot (column, area etc.) as gradient, this attribute lets you set the fill alpha for gradient.
attrs.name: plotFillAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control the opacity of the bar. You can adjust its transparency by setting a value between 0 (completely transparent) and 100 (fully opaque).
attrs.name: barAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute sets the opacity of the track behind the bar. It accepts values from 0 to 100, helping you fine-tune the background visibility to complement or contrast the bar.
attrs.name: trackAlpha

attrs.description: Whether to apply the shadow effect for pie/doughnuts.
attrs.name: showShadow

attrs.description: This attribute lets you introduce a URL of an image or icon to be rendered. This attribute needs to be added at data level.
attrs.name: icon

attrs.description: This attribute lets you increase or decrease the label icon size. This attribute will only work when the attribute `icon` is specified.
attrs.name: iconScale

attrs.description: This attribute lets you specify the position of the icon. This attribute will only work when the attribute `icon` is specified.
attrs.name: iconPosition

description: These attributes let you configure how your plot (columns, lines, area, or any data that you're plotting) will appear on the chart. If the plots can show borders, you can control the border properties using the attributes listed below. Or, if they support gradient fills, you can again configure various properties of the gradient using these attributes. Various other controls over plot cosmetics can be attained using this set of attributes.

attrs.description: This attribute lets you explicitly set the inner radius of the chart. This attribute is useful if you want to enforce one of your own values.
attrs.name: innerRadius

attrs.description: This attribute lets you explicitly set the outer radius of the chart. By defining inner and outer radius together, you can define the width/thickness of the bar as well.
attrs.name: outerRadius

attrs.description: Angle from where the radial bar will start drawing. By default, the start angle will be 90° and the track will run in a clockwise direction.
attrs.name: startAngle

attrs.description: Attribute that controls and enforces the ending angle of the track. By default, the end angle will be 180°.
attrs.name: endAngle

description: The following attributes let you control various functionalities of radial bar chart.

attrs.description: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if 'formatNumber': '1'; and 40000 if 'formatNumber': '0';.
attrs.name: formatNumber

attrs.description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if `formatNumberScale` is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
attrs.name: formatNumberScale

attrs.description: The default unit of the numbers that you're providing to the chart.
attrs.name: defaultNumberScale

attrs.description: Unit of each block of the scale.
attrs.name: numberScaleUnit

attrs.description: Range of the various blocks that constitute the scale.
attrs.name: numberScaleValue

attrs.description:
If a data value is less than the lowest given number is the number scale, this attribute forces the lower value of the  `numberScaleUnit` to be applied to that data value.  This attribute works only when `“formatNumberScale”: “1”` and the `defaultNumberScale` attribute is not defined. 

For example, if `“numberScaleUnit”: “K, M”`, `“numberScaleValue”: “1000, 1000”`, and `“forceNumberScale”: “1”`, a data value of __400__ will be rendered as __0.40K__.
attrs.name: forceNumberScale

attrs.description: Whether recursive scaling should be applied.
attrs.name: scaleRecursively

attrs.description: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling? -1 completes the entire set of recursion.
attrs.name: maxScaleRecursion

attrs.description: What character to use to separate the scales that are generated after recursion?
attrs.name: scaleSeparator

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to $ to show like $40000, $50000.
attrs.name: numberPrefix

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you could add a suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figures quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to '/a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a.
attrs.name: numberSuffix

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the decimal separator in a number.
attrs.name: decimalSeparator

attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the thousands separator in a number.
attrs.name: thousandSeparator

attrs.description: This option helps you specify the position of the thousand separator.
attrs.name: thousandSeparatorPosition

attrs.description: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. So, FusionCharts XT accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the decimal separator.
attrs.name: inDecimalSeparator

attrs.description: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. So, FusionCharts XT accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the thousand separator.
attrs.name: inThousandSeparator

attrs.description: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to.
attrs.name: decimals

attrs.description: Whether to add 0 padding at the end of decimal numbers. For example, if you set decimals as 2 and a number is 23.4. If forceDecimals is set to 1, FusionCharts XT will convert the number to 23.40 (note the extra 0 at the end).
attrs.name: forceDecimals

description: FusionCharts XT offers you a lot of options to format your numbers on the chart. Using the attributes below, you can control a myriad of options like: Formatting of commas and decimals Number prefixes and suffixes Decimal places to which the numbers will round to Scaling of numbers based on a user defined scale Custom number input formats

attrs.description: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart.
attrs.name: baseFont

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here. Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: baseFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.
attrs.name: baseFontColor

description: Using the attributes below, you can define the generic font properties for all the text on the chart. These attributes allow you a high level control over font properties. If you intend to specify font properties for individual chart elements (like Caption, sub-caption etc.), you'll need to use the Styles feature of FusionCharts XT. Using Styles, you can also specify advanced font properties like Bold, Italics, HTML Mode etc.

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font family for the text.
attrs.name: labelFont

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font color.
attrs.name: labelFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the x-axis label font size. Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: labelFontSize

attrs.description: Flag indicating whether x-axis label font should be bold or not.
attrs.name: labelFontBold

attrs.description: Flag indicating whether x-axis label font should be italicized or not.
attrs.name: labelFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for x-axis label text.
attrs.name: labelBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the color of the border around the x-axis label text.
attrs.name: labelBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label alpha for both font and background.
attrs.name: labelAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label background alpha.
attrs.name: labelBgAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border alpha.
attrs.name: labelBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border padding.
attrs.name: labelBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border radius.
attrs.name: labelBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label border thickness.
attrs.name: labelBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Whether the border around x-axis labels should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: labelBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the x-axis labels are rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: labelBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around x-axis labels are rendered using dashed lines.
attrs.name: labelBorderDashGap

attrs.description: Sets a link for every data plot label.
attrs.name: labelLink

attrs.description: Enables the use of pattern fills at global level.
attrs.name: usePattern

attrs.description: Set the type of pattern. Possible values are: `circle`, `square`, and `line`. The default value is `line`
attrs.name: patternType

attrs.description: Set the angle of the pattern fill in degrees. The default value is 40 for lines and 0 for circle and square.
attrs.name: patternAngle

attrs.description: Set the density of pattern fill shapes in pixels. The default value is 6.
attrs.name: patternDensity

attrs.description:
Set the size of the pattern fill shape.

It sets the thickness of lines, the default value is 2.
It sets the diameter of circles, the default value is 4.
It sets the length of squares, the default value is 4.
attrs.name: patternSize

attrs.description: Sets the color of pattern shapes in 6-digit hex color notation. By default, it inherits values from `paletteColors`.
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: Set the opacity of pattern shapes in %. The default value is 100.
attrs.name: patternAlpha

attrs.description: Set the background color for pattern fills in 6-digit hex color notation.
attrs.name: patternBgColor

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of all data labels of the chart.

attrs.description: Whether to show legend on the chart.
attrs.name: showLegend

attrs.description: Whether legend keys should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: legendItemFontBold

attrs.description: Sets legend item font
attrs.name: legendItemFont

attrs.description: Sets legend item font size
attrs.name: legendItemFontSize

attrs.description: Sets legend item font color
attrs.name: legendItemFontColor

attrs.description: Sets legend item font color on hover
attrs.name: legendItemHoverFontColor

attrs.description: The legend can be plotted at different positions with respect to the chart. Note that if the value of `legendPosition` is set to `absolute`, you also need to set the coordinates of the legend. You can do that using the attributes `legendXPosition` and `legendYPosition`, both of which accept absolute or percentage values.
attrs.range: bottom, right, top, top-left, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-right, left, left-top, left-bottom, right, right-top, right-bottom, and absolute
attrs.name: legendPosition

attrs.description: When the value of `legendPosition` is set to `absolute`, use this attribute to set the X-coordinate of the legend. It accepts absolute or percentage values. By default, its value is set to `0`.
attrs.name: legendXPosition

attrs.description: When the value of `legendPosition` is set to `absolute`, use this attribute to set the Y-coordinate of the legend. It accepts absolute or percentage values. By default, its value is set to `0`.
attrs.name: legendYPosition

attrs.description: Sets the number of rows the legend should display.
attrs.name: legendNumRows

attrs.description: Sets the number of columns the legend should display.
attrs.name: legendNumColumns

attrs.description: Sets the legend caption horizontal alignment .
attrs.name: legendCaptionAlignment

attrs.description: Whether legend caption should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontBold

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font
attrs.name: legendCaptionFont

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font size
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets legend caption font color
attrs.name: legendCaptionFontColor

attrs.description: You can add a caption for the entire legend by setting the same here.
attrs.name: legendCaption

attrs.description: Sets the color that applies on both text font and icon when they are in a  disabled / hidden state
attrs.name: legendItemHiddenColor

attrs.description: Scaling of legend icon is possible in FusionCharts XT. This attribute lets you control the size of the legend icon. The default scale value is 1. Anything less than 1 reduces the size of the legend-icons on the chart. Any value bigger than 1 enlarges the icons. e.g., 0.5 means half the size, where as, 2 means twice the size.
attrs.name: legendIconScale

attrs.description: Background color for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBgColor

attrs.description: Background alpha for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBgAlpha

attrs.description: Border Color for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderColor

attrs.description: Border thickness for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderThickness

attrs.description: Border alpha for the legend.
attrs.name: legendBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Whether to show a shadow for legend.
attrs.name: legendShadow

attrs.description: The legend can be made drag-able by setting this attribute to 1. End viewers of the chart can drag the legend around on the chart.
attrs.name: legendAllowDrag

attrs.description: If you've too many items on the legend, a scroll bar shows up on the same. This attribute lets you configure the background color of the scroll bar.
attrs.name: legendScrollBgColor

attrs.description: You can reverse the ordering of datasets in the legend by setting this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: reverseLegend

attrs.description: This attribute lets you interact with the legend in your chart. When you click a particular legend key, the associated slice slides out from the chart. Re-clicking the key causes the slice to slide in.
attrs.name: interactiveLegend

attrs.description: The legend items are arranged in columns. Using this attribute, you can propose the number of columns. This value undergoes internal checking on judicious use of white-space. In case, the value is found improper, the chart auto-calculates the number of columns. When set to 0, the chart automatically decides the number of columns. The above is applicable when `legendPosition` is set to BOTTOM`.` If you have set RIGHT `legendPosition`, the number of columns is always set to 1.
attrs.name: legendNumColumns

attrs.description: Whether to minimize legend item text wrapping.
attrs.name: minimiseWrappingInLegend

attrs.description:
Specifies whether drawing a custom legend icon will be enabled. All legend icon customization attributes will work only if this feature is enabled. 

Default value: 0 (disabled)
attrs.name: drawCustomLegendIcon

attrs.description:
Sets the border color for the legend icon. 

Default value: Data plot border color
attrs.name: legendIconBorderColor

attrs.description:
Sets the background color for the legend icon. 

Default value: Data plot fill color
attrs.name: legendIconBgColor

attrs.description:
Sets the legend icon transparency. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: legendIconAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the legend icon background transparency. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: legendIconBgAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the number of sides for the legend icon. 

Default value: 4
attrs.name: legendIconSides

attrs.description:
Sets the thickness of the legend icon border. 

Default value: 1
attrs.name: legendIconBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Sets the starting angle of for drawing the legend icon. 

Default value: 45
attrs.name: legendIconStartAngle

attrs.description: This attribute, if set to `0`, the legend box will be center aligned with respect to the entire width of the chart only if the total width of the legend box is more than the canvas width. By default, the legend box is center aligned with respect to the canvas width and it remains the same if the width of the legend box is less than the canvas width.
attrs.name: alignLegendWithCanvas

attrs.description: This attribute is set to `0` by default. When set to `1`, this attribute replaces the legend shape with icons using a new global attribute called.
attrs.name: showIconInLegend

description: In radial bar charts, the name of each slice shows up in the legend of the chart. If you do not need the legend, you can opt to hide it. Additionally, the legend can be placed at the bottom of the chart or to the right of it. Using the attributes below, you can configure the functional and cosmetic properties of the legend.

attrs.description: Whether to show tool tip on chart.
attrs.name: showToolTip

attrs.description: Background color for tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipBgColor

attrs.description: Font color for the tool-tip.
attrs.name: toolTipColor

attrs.description: Border color for tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the border transparency for tool tip.
attrs.name: tooltipBorderAlpha

attrs.description: The character specified as the value of this attribute separates the name and value displayed in tool tip.
attrs.name: toolTipSepChar

attrs.description: Whether to show shadow for tool-tips on the chart.
attrs.name: showToolTipShadow

attrs.description: Sets the transparency of the tooltip.
attrs.name: tooltipbgalpha

attrs.description: Sets the border radius of the tooltip.
attrs.name: tooltipborderradius

attrs.description: Sets the border thickness of the tooltip.
attrs.name: tooltipborderthickness

attrs.description: This attribute sets the vertical space between the value and the border of the tooltip. If you want more space between the value and the border, you can use this attribute to control it.
attrs.name: toolTipPadding

attrs.description:
Specify custom text for the tooltip 

 You can either specify a constant string as the tooltip text or you can use variable values from the data level by prefixing a __$__ to the attribute name, for example, __$name__, __$value__.
attrs.name: plottooltext

attrs.description: Configure the tooltip's position.
attrs.name: tooltipPosition

description: These attributes let you control the tool tip. You can set the background color, border color, separator character and few other details.

attrs.description: Where to position the toolbar on the chart: TL - Top-left TR - Top-right BR - Bottom right BL - Bottom left CC - Center of screen
attrs.name: toolbarPosition

attrs.description: Sets the toolbox position on the chart with respect to x-axis.
attrs.name: toolbarX

attrs.description: Sets the toolbox position on the chart with respect to y-axis.
attrs.name: toolbarY

attrs.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the toolbar on the chart.
attrs.name: toolbarHAlign

attrs.description: Sets the vertical alignment of the toolbar on the chart
attrs.name: toolbarVAlign

attrs.description: Sets the color of the toolbar buttons.
attrs.name: toolbarButtonColor

attrs.description: Enables/disables display of tooltips for toolbar buttons.
attrs.name: showToolBarButtonTooltext

attrs.description: You can change the scale of the toolbar by specifying a value for this attribute.
attrs.name: toolbarButtonScale

description: Using this set of attributes, you can customize the toolbar on the chart. The advantage of having a toolbar is that it manages all the UI action elements (context menus, checkboxes, buttons) centrally. This provides a clean, uniform look and a better, more meaningful and logical grouping.

attrs.description:
Whether the chart will allow exporting to images, PDFs, SVG, XLSX or CSV format.  

__Default value__: 0
attrs.name: exportEnabled

attrs.description:
In case of server-side exporting, the action specifies whether the exported image will be sent back to the client as a download, or whether it'll be saved on the server. 

__Default value__: download
attrs.name: exportAction

attrs.description: In case of server-side exporting, this refers to the path of the server-side export handler (the ready-to-use scripts that we provide).
attrs.name: exportHandler

attrs.description: Lets you configure what output formats to allow for export of chart, in the export context menu, and also customize the label for each menu item. The attribute value should be a pipe (|) delimited separated key-value pair. Example: `exportFormats: 'PNG=Export as High Quality Image|JPG|PDF=Export as PDF File'`
attrs.name: exportFormats

attrs.description:
This attribute sets the modes of export. To enable client-side exporting, set this attribute to __client__. 

__Default value__: auto. 

__Note__: Starting v3.12.1, the `exportMode` attribute replaces the `exportAtClientSide` attribute. However, you don’t need to make any changes to the existing setup because, the FusionCharts library comes with the proper mapping already provided.
attrs.name: exportMode

attrs.description: Whether the menu items related to export (e.g., Save as JPEG, etc.) will appear in the context menu of the chart.
attrs.name: exportShowMenuItem

attrs.description:
In case of server-side exporting and when using download as action, this lets you configure whether the return image, PDF, SVG, or XLSX will open in same window (as an attachment for download), or whether it will open in a new window. 

__Default value__: _self
attrs.name: exportTargetWindow

attrs.description: Using this attribute, you can specify the name (excluding the extension) of the output (export) file.
attrs.name: exportFileName

description: These attributes allow you to control the saving of chart as image, SVG or XLSX.

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control the space (in pixels) between the sub-caption and top of the pie. If the sub-caption is not defined, it controls the space between the caption and top of the pie. If neither caption, nor sub-caption is defined, this padding does not come into play.
attrs.name: captionPadding

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control the space between bar and track. The default value will be 0.
attrs.name: trackPadding

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control the space between adjacent tracks. It creates separation between different tracks to improve clarity and readability. The default value will be 6px.
attrs.name: trackMargin

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control and modify the radius of the track corners at the start of the track.
attrs.name: trackStartRadius

attrs.description: This attribute lets you control and modify the radius of the track corners at the end of the track.
attrs.name: trackEndRadius

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to customize the roundness of the bar's leading edge by adjusting the corner radius at the start of the track. Increasing the value creates more rounded corners, giving the bar a smoother, softer appearance at its starting point.
attrs.name: barStartRadius

attrs.description: This attribute allows you to customize the roundness of the bar's leading edge by adjusting the corner radius at the end of the track. Increasing the value creates more rounded corners, giving the bar a smoother, softer appearance at its starting point.
attrs.name: barEndRadius

description: The following attributes help you control chart margins and paddings. FusionCharts XT allows you to manually customize the padding of various elements on the chart to allow advanced manipulation and control over chart visualization. You can also define the chart margins. Chart Margins refer to the empty space left on the top, bottom, left and right of the chart. That means, FusionCharts XT will not plot anything in that space. It's not necessary for you to specify any padding/margin values. FusionCharts Suite XT automatically assumes the best values for the same, if you do not specify the same.

attrs.description: This attribute determines the transparency of a data item. The range for this attribute is 0 to 100. 0 means complete transparency (the data item won't be shown on the graph) and 100 means opaque.
attrs.name: alpha

attrs.description: If you want to set border alpha of individual pie/doughnut data items, you can specify using this attribute.
attrs.name: borderAlpha

attrs.description: If you want to set border color of individual pie/doughnut data items, you can specify using this attribute.
attrs.name: borderColor

attrs.description: This attribute sets the border around the track. The attribute can be set to `solid`, `none`, or `dashed`, and the default value is `none`.
attrs.name: trackBorder

attrs.description: This attribute defines the border around the bar itself. The attribute can be set to `solid`, `none`, `dashed`, and the default value is `none`.
attrs.name: barBorder

attrs.description: This attribute sets the opacity level of the track's border.
attrs.name: trackBorderAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute controls the transparency of the bar's border.
attrs.name: barBorderAlpha

attrs.description: This attribute controls the thickness of the border around the track. Adjusting this value helps define how strongly the track is framed within the chart.
attrs.name: trackBorderThickness

attrs.description: This attribute sets the thickness of the border around the bar. You can increase or decrease the value to make the bar’s outline more prominent or subtle.
attrs.name: barBorderThickness

attrs.description: If you want to define your own colors for the data items on the chart, use this attribute to specify color for the data item.
attrs.name: color

attrs.description: Sets the background color of the bar in pattern shapes of 6-digit hex color notation. This attribute needs to be set on both chart and data level.
attrs.name: trackFillColor

attrs.description: Whether the border of this data item should appear as dashed. This is particularly useful when you want to highlight a data (such as forecast or trend etc.).
attrs.name: dashed

attrs.description: If instead of the numerical value of this data, you wish to display a custom string value, you can specify the same here. Examples are annotation for a data item etc.
attrs.name: displayValue

attrs.description: This attribute determines whether a pie slice appears as a part of the total chart or is sliced out as an individual item.
attrs.name: isSliced

attrs.description:
This attribute determines the label for the data item. The label appears on the x-axis of chart.

 __Note__: The `label` attribute replaces the `name` attribute. Previously, either one of the attributes could be used to set the label. Support for the `name` attribute has been discontinued since v3.10.0.
attrs.name: label

attrs.description: You can define links for individual data items. That enables the end user to click on data items (columns, lines, bars etc.) and drill down to other pages. To define the link for data items, use the link attribute. You can define links that open in same window, new window, pop-up window or frames. Please see "Drill-Down > Using JavaScript Functions as Links" for more information. Also, you'll need to Url Encode all the special characters (like ? and &) present in the link.
attrs.name: link

attrs.description: You can individually opt to show/hide labels of individual data items using this attribute.
attrs.name: showLabel

attrs.description: You can individually opt to show/hide values of individual data items using this attribute.
attrs.name: showValue

attrs.description:
This attribute places the data label outside/inside of a particular pie slice. 

Default value: Outside
attrs.name: labelPosition

attrs.description: This attribute places the data value inside of a particular track. The default value is 0.
attrs.name: placeValuesInside

attrs.description: By default, FusionCharts XT shows the data item name and value as tool tip text for that data item. But, if you want to display more information for the data item as tool tip, you can use this attribute to specify the same.
attrs.name: toolText

attrs.description: Numerical value for the data item. This value will be plotted on the chart.
attrs.name: value

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font family for the text.
attrs.name: labelFont

attrs.description: Sets the x-axis label font color.
attrs.name: labelFontColor

attrs.description: Specifies the x-axis label font size. Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: labelFontSize

attrs.description: This attribute sets the vertical space between the labels and canvas bottom edge. If you want more space between the canvas and the x-axis labels, you can use this attribute to control it.
attrs.name: labelPadding

attrs.description: Helps configure the position of the vLine label by setting a relative position between 0 and 1. In vertical charts, 0 means top of canvas and 1 means bottom. In horizontal charts, 0 means left of canvas and 1 means right.
attrs.name: labelPosition

description:
In single-series charts, each instance of the `data` object represents a data value to be plotted on the chart. For a single-series chart, one instance of the `data` object looks as shown in the example below: 

"data"[{
		"label": "Jan",
		"value": "10000"
	}]
Attributes of the `data` object are used to set and configure the data values for the chart.
